result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Richard T Ellison

defendant.name: Ellison, Richard T
defendant.address: N54 N519 Highland Dr, Cedarburg, WI 53012

records.addlTxt: 10:16 AM Prosecuting attorney Benjamin Lindsay in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Richard T Ellison not in court.  Attorney Rachel Marie Boaz in court for Richard T Ellison.  Counsel unaware why defendant does not appear. Court notes defendant has not complied with competency evaluation. State requests a warrant. Court will forfeit bail and issue warrant.
Letter Wisconsin Forensic Unit Re: Non Appearance for Evaluation - doc for review to clerk DA
Windy Ridge Care re: request for defendant to appear by Zoom for the 4/14/22 hearing, forwarded to DA document review.

10:47 AM Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol appeared with student Maria Penkwitz in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Richard T Ellison appeared in court, Attorney Rachel Marie Boaz appeared in court for Richard T Ellison.  Counsel has obtain financial information and indicates the defendant does qualify. Defendant did not appear for competency evaluation due to no working phone number for defendant. Counsel provides court with name/contact number for the owner of the group home where defendant resides. Atty Boaz will contact the forensic unit and arrange for competency evaluation to be completed. Time limits waived.
Further proceedings scheduled for April 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on April 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Wisconsin Forensic re: No Contact.  Forwarded as document for review to Branch 3 clerk .
Court grants request for extension for report to be filed.  2/15/22 hearing adjourned to 2/21/22
Wisconsin Forensic Unit re: Request for Extension.  Forwarded as document for review to Branch 3 clerk .

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.  No violent contact with the residents at his group home located on Highland Drive.

1:13 PM Prosecuting attorney Kerra Stumbris appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Richard T Ellison appeared by video, in custody of OZSD.  Atty Boaz appears as a friend of the court and believes there is a competency issue with the defendant. Court finds probable cause. Counsel will attempt to contact the defendant's guardian thru the group home.  Court orders competency exam.
Arraignment scheduled for February 15, 2022 at 10:00 am.
